comment: This class was a lot—surprised it wasn't 4 credits. Long discussion posts and real-life scenario analyses made it time-consuming, but I learned a lot. Only take it if your course load isn't heavy, or else your performance in other classes may suffer. Great content, just very demanding alongside a full course load.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Nice professor, cares abt students. Class had lots of coursework. Every week was a lengthy discussion post. YOU WILL NEED TO BUY TEXTBOOK. Discussion post would have like 15 questions and one lengthy reply to a peer. She grades tough even on the replies. Class was not too hard, make sure to answer every question on the discussion. One paper too.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Do yourself a favour and take Dr. Mainella! She is a super awesome teacher and the class is not too difficult if you put in the effort. She makes earning most of your grade decently easy and she is super accessible to reach if you have questions or concerns. If you need an elective, you will not regret taking her!!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Mainella is truly an amazing and caring person! Her leadership course was very inspiring and insightful. I really recommend this course in person as it is like a seminar style and wants you to engage and get to know your peers & yourself. 10/10! If you are not planning to show up and engage, please do not register for this class.

I loved Dr Mainella! She was so sweet and even to the point where she did a teams meeting to explain APA style because I was lost. You do have a paper which is 4-6 pages long but itâ€™s a interview paper which I enjoyed writing. Discussion post every week with feedback. Your final is the only test. Just stay on top of your work and your good!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Mainella is passionate about Leadership. She is truly wonderful and you will learn SO MUCH from her course! This class is not an easy A, but if you are interested in leadership and really want to learn and grow as a leader, then take her class - you won't regret it! Also, ignore the bad reviews - they're just not true!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: TAKE HER. Please do not go by these bad ratings. I have had Dr. Mainella for 2 classes. I am getting ready to take her for a 3rd class. She is such an amazing person, professor and leader. You have to participate, but I promise you if you do, you will gain so much from her classes. Everything she assigns will help you on exams and in real life.

If you are willing to participate, TAKE HER! This is my second class with Dr. Mainella, and I will be taking her again next semester. She comes up with some great activities and really tries to connect with her students. The exams are not easy, but if you take notes and read you will be fine.

She sucks. The whole class has a C and she is blaming us and not her horrible teaching! All she does is assign textbook questions and no matter how detailed you are, you won't make higher than an 85. She isn't specific with her feedback, just rude and uses excessive question marks without making a point. Just like this?? Anyway don't take her class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Took Dr. Mainella in summer; this was a mistake. The workload was WAY too immense (this from someone who works 4 weeks ahead in a normal semester). Her use of grammar is poor at best, yet she deducts heavily for simply mistakes (like misspellings, grammer) on papers. She is rather vague with her descriptions, and is slow with responses to email.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Mainella is an amazing person. She tries to include hands on application into her teaching style which I enjoyed. She is a kind and caring person and offers great advice. I would highly recommend her.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: This was not the usual laidback Leadership class. Dr. Mainella is a tough grader and demands plenty from her students. There were weekly discussion posts, quizzes, 3 major tests, a major paper and a major group project. And on top of all this, shes a tough grader. See what I mean? You will work very hard in this class. Get ready to read and study!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: I love Dr. Mainella! She is so kind and caring. I loved this class and am going to take more classes with Dr. Mainella in the following semesters. One paper (easy) and a group project based on the paper. Easy but you just gotta do it. I love her and am super thankful for her.

Overall Professor Mainella's class was not that hard. There was a bunch of time consuming discussion board posts though. Almost every week there was a quiz (very easy) and a discussion board post where you had to read/watch the material for that week. There was a midterm, a final, and one paper.

Just don't take this if its not needed, took this because I needed an elective that could help me efficiently but its harder than some of my major courses. Really regret this. Tests are way too hard with way too much material that's all over the place. dont to this to yourself

Professor Mainella has been one of my favorite professors so far. Her lectures can get boring at times, but participation will help you enjoy the class. Tests are a little hard but she always provides a study guide, just make sure you study. Attendance isn't mandatory, and only benefits as extra credit at the end of the semester.
An amazing teacher who cares about her students and their success. Approachable and willing to help in any way. If you are looking for a great learning experience I would say this teacher is for you!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: This woman is great. She cares about her students more than anything. Pay attention and study a little and you'll be fine. She gets really upset when people don't come to class and when people in class don't participate. Reallyyyyy upset. She wants the best for you. Super easy course. Just have to care.

I took Mainella this past fall semester and she was amazing. Her lectures are fun and she really allows all the students to get involved. She is kind and open to all opinions and beliefs. I highly recommend her as her class was not hard at all and she is always there to help her students!

Uses the point system & believes that your attendance grade is a favor even though its stated in the syllabus that its included in your final grade. Does not respond to emails & is rude when you approach her. Referred to me as the one who emailed me, & could not remember my name even though I was in every class. Avoid her class if you can.
She is such a nice person and a great teacher! Lots of lectures, but take notes and you'll be good for the tests

She's a sweet lady but a push-over. Doesn't enforce attendance but gets mas when people keep coming late. She also over explains things like she thinks we're all idiots. Overall it's an easy class but boring. Just go to class and do the assignments and you'll be fine.

Dr. Mainella was a very nice professor. Unfortunately I did not enjoy the course material. I recommend not taking this class unless you are required to. If you are required to take this class then Dr. Mainella is a good choice.

I didn't like her at first, as she comes across as condescending, but by midterms I really started to like her and I think the class warmed up to her. We didn't have many grades but as long as you study the notes for the test you can get an A. She does go fast towards the end and it's hard to keep up, but overall I really enjoyed the class.

She was a great professor! Her lectures were interesting, and she related the material to several TV shows to make it understandable. She is very caring and wants students to be successful in her class. Her tests were not difficult if you study a little. She also is a lenient grader on papers. I would definitely take her class again!!!
Professor Mainella is not too bad. The class, Leadership is sort of a b.s. class. I will say that Prof. Mainella is very kind and is understanding.
Interesting lectures, and tests are mostly based on powerpoints.
Overall a Great Teacher. She was very knowledgeable about the subjects. Personable. I would like to hang out with her outside of class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: So sweet and passionate about what she does! Expects you to come to every class and participate in discussions, which is fine because the concepts are usually interesting. Pop quizzes frequently but they can only give you credit, not lose any. Should definitely read when it comes time to study for her tests.
If you think this will be the usual relaxed and fun leadership class think again. Temperamental teacher, you have to memorize complete chapters to pass her exams and she grades papers meticulously.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great lady, amazing scholar but sadly she needs to revise her syllabus and understand how to deal with her students when she is under stress. She got a lot of complains from students and easily got frustrated and mad. Her syllabus is very demanding and she takes attendance every single class.

Dr. Mainella is easily one of the best professors I have had at KSU. She doesn't make the class a piece of cake, but she makes the class interesting and it makes you really want to earn the A. She is passionate about leadership and genuinely a great person/professor. I am taking her again in the spring for another class and I cannot wait! Take her!
Solid ethical teacher. Cares about students. Open to feedback. Read a lot for the quiz. Heavy studying for test but nothing abnormal. I'd take her again, hands down.

I thoroughly enjoyed Professor Mainella. She is so caring and nice. It's a lot to leadership so expect to study for the midterm and final. Reading and taking notes is imperative but her class is fun and you really learn a lot. This class was totally worth my cash and time.
